channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Snowdon: Call to respect mountain amid spike in visitors
item.description: Litter, erosion and traffic put "significant pressure" on the mountain, says the Snowdonia Society.

item.title: Cwmllynfell rugby player Alex Evans dies during match
item.description: Alex Evans's team says they have "lost a brother on the field and it is hurting so much".

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Woman shot by husband wants gun law change
item.description: Rachel Williams, whose estranged husband shot her in 2011, says guns should not be kept at home.

item.title: Covid: People working out at gyms longer and later at night
item.description: Are "peak times" at the gym a thing of the past as people visit around work and childcare?

item.title: Paralympics: Calls for wheelchair motocross to be in Games
item.description: There are calls for the adaptive skateboarding sport to be in the Paralympics by 2028.

item.title: Sepsis: Teen footballer wants better care for young adults
item.description: Hollie Smith, 19, dreamed of playing for Wales - but after sepsis she needs round-the-clock care.

item.title: Covid: Antibody tests offered to public for first time
item.description: The UK-wide scheme for adults who test positive for coronavirus will launch next week.

item.title: Burry Port: Fear for children after asbestos found on beach
item.description: Campaigners are calling for the removal of what they say is hazardous waste uncovered by erosion.

item.title: Clydach murders: Killer David Morris dies in prison
item.description: David Morris was serving a 32-year sentence for killing three generations of the same family.

item.title: Llandudno: Dog rescued after falling from cliff
item.description: Five RNLI staff had to help to rescue Tug, a Cocker Spaniel, who became was stuck among rocks.

item.title: Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal boaters asked to share stories
item.description: A tradition dating back three decades of writing about adventures on the water has been restarted.

item.title: Message in a bottle washes up after 3,000-mile journey
item.description: Amanda Tidmarsh found the message, from near Canada, while walking her dogs in south Wales.

item.title: Snowdon: 'This is the worst queuing I can remember'
item.description: A group maintaining the mountain warns of the pressures large numbers of visitors bring.

item.title: Green Man: Festival returns in the Welsh mountains after Covid restrictions
item.description: Wales' largest music festival, Green Man, returns with 25,000 people in attendance.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Gun survivor calls for change to firearms laws
item.description: A woman who survived being shot in 2011 wants tougher gun laws following the Plymouth shooting.

item.title: Syrian family in Cardigan advise Afghan refugees about Wales
item.description: The Alchikhs made Cardigan their home after spending three years in a Lebanese refugee camp.

item.title: Covid: 'I watched my father, 85, die gasping for breath'
item.description: A woman, whose dad died with Covid after going to hospital with an infection, calls for answers.

item.title: Wrexham: Hollywood-style sign mystery solved
item.description: Many thought Wrexham AFC's new owners, Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, were behind the stunt.

item.title: British Open: Mark Williams beats Gary Wilson to win second title - 24 years after first
item.description: Mark Williams beats Gary Wilson 6-4 in the British Open final to win the ranking event for a second time - 24 years after his first victory.

item.title: Tanni Grey-Thompson column: 'Tokyo can still be a step forward for Paralympics'
item.description: Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson believes the Tokyo Paralympics can still take the movement to another level.

item.title: Levante 3-3 Real Madrid: Gareth Bale scores in thriller
item.description: Real Madrid and Levante play out a six-goal thriller that saw Gareth Bale's first La Liga goal since 2019 and an outfield player end up in goal.

item.title: Meet the Welsh athletes competing at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics
item.description: BBC Sport Wales profiles the Welsh athletes who will be competing at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics

item.title: 'If Flinty goes on like this he's going to score about 40 this year' - Cardiff's Morrison
item.description: Cardiff captain Sean Morrison praises fellow defender Aden Flint after his goal double and one from Morrison himself earn a 3-1 win over Millwall.

item.title: Pryder am effaith Statws Treftadaeth ar gymunedau llechi
item.description: Cwpl o Ddinorwig yn bryderus am sgil effeithiau'r dynodiad UNESCO ar gymunedau'r ardal lechi.

item.title: Yr Wyddfa: Galw ar gerddwyr i 'barchu'r mynydd'
item.description: Mae sbwriel ac erydiad llwybrau wedi rhoi "pwysau sylweddol" ar y mynydd, medd Cymdeithas Eryri.

item.title: Dyn 80 oed yn cerdded Cader Idris er cof am ei fab
item.description: Tom Jones wedi dringo i gopa'r mynydd ar ei ben-blwydd er cof am ei fab fu farw o ganser y gwaed.

item.title: Cerdyn post oddi wrth... Llŷr Alun
item.description: Wythnos hon, Llŷr Alun neu 'Llŷr Am Dro' sydd yn anfon cyfarchion i ni o bier Bangor.

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Caerdydd 3-1 Millwall
item.description: Record ddiguro Caerdydd yn parhau wrth i Aden Flint sgorio ddwywaith am yr eildro mewn wythnos.
